title: Add a way to sort songs from the added date, like iTunes does by default
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I'm always frustrated when trying to listen to my most recently added songs, without having to go to the "Recently Added" tab, because this can't play every song one after the other without having to manually play them.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Something like the iOS and Android apps have - see screenshot below.

**Additional context**
Screenshot: https://prnt.sc/qmdt0c

title: BUG: PLAY_ACTIVITY error in console when skipping songs
body:
When I press the button to skip songs, it consistently logs this error. It seems like it's a MusicKit issue because it seems to be plaguing all other Apple Music web players. It's not super consequential, other than it occasionally plays a half-second of the beginning of the previous song or some other short hiccup before skipping properly. I just wondered if there's any way of avoiding this error, as I'm trying to use the MusitKit functionality on my own website.

Uncaught (in promise) PLAY_ACTIVITY: A play stop() method was called without a previous play() descriptor
    at Function.MKError.playActivityError (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:25498)
    at PlayActivity.<anonymous> (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:36354)
    at https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:14473
    at Object.next (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:14578)
    at https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:13494
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at __awaiter (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:13229)
    at PlayActivity.stop (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:35849)
    at PlayActivity.<anonymous> (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:33878)
    at https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:14473
    at Object.next (https://js-cdn.music.apple.com/musickit/v1/musickit.js:1:14578)

title: Show album released year in album details
body:
Hi,

What is currently missing and really disappointing in Musish is that there's no album release date in album information window.
For example: https://beta.music.apple.com/ru/album/man-on-the-run-track-by-track-commentary/947975010 has it - 2014
But https://musi.sh/album/911604957 - no.

Also it looks to me that albums are not sorted anyhow or the logic is unclear. Normally albums should be sorted by the release date which luckily beta.music.apple.com/ does.
It would be really good if you could improve this.

Thank you!

title: BUG: Song repeats when playing in a queue
body:
**Describe the bug**
When songs are shuffled, before starting the next song, the song that has just been played plays again for 1-3 seconds and then only, the next song starts.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Start playing a song
2. Click Shuffle
3. Listen when next song starts

**Expected behavior**
Next song should start as and when the previous song is over.

**Screenshots**
NA

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: Windows
- Browser Chrome
- Version v79.0.3945.79

title: Prepare the player before playback
body:
https://developer.apple.com/documentation/musickitjs/musickit/player/2992763-preparetoplay

Wait for the player to prepare before actually playing

title: BUG: A song doesn't start to play – no clicks accepted
body:
**Describe the bug**
Not possible to play a song.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to the start page, "For You" section or any other section populated with songs.
2. Click on any track. No response.
3. Scroll down to the mini-player and press "play" button. No response.
4. No sound.

**Expected behavior: The playback starts**


**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**

- OS: macOS
- Browser: Firefox Legacy 67 for Lion, Safari 9, Firefox 69 in Mavericks, Safari 13, Firefox 69 in High Sierra 
- Version: any

title: FEATURE Make it a PWA (Progressive Web App)
body:
Needs a service-worker.js and a manfist.json in the root. You can load the service-worker.js from your js, just check MDN PWA docs.

This will allow you to install it was a standalone PWA on linux. You'll get an application icon in the application bar.

title: FEATURE: Push song metadata + album art to Windows Media controls
body:
Currently, when a track is playing on musi.sh, Windows 10's media control overlay (the thing that pops up when you hit the volume buttons) shows no information about the current playing track. It ends up looking like this:
![Screenshot (40)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54860812/64265591-d5a1e100-cf50-11e9-853b-9938200a8e37.png)

Fever Tunes, another Apple Music JS web player, pushes song metadata to these same controls, and it looks like this:
![Screenshot (41)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54860812/64265609-daff2b80-cf50-11e9-87d8-b274247c9b55.png)

I'm not trying to say FeverTunes is better or trying to compare the two, promise! The intent is to describe the problem using a similar service, is all. This shouldn't be too hard to implement, I think. It makes good use of native Windows API, too. 

Thanks for such a great web app!

title: MediaSession API support
body:
MediaSession typing file, Keyboard support for multimedia keys and metadata in media notifications.

As requested in issue #296

title: FEATURE: Allow Remote Control of playback from other devices
body: I thought about a nice feature to allow connecting from multiple devices, and share session, that way for example I can connect iPad to speakers, and play music from there, and control the music played on iPad from every device, either other iOS or Android, or maybe with the assistance of some app, using Apple Watch.

title: BUG: Next track shortcut conflicts with Windows shortcut for switching desktops.
body:
**Describe the bug**
Next track shortcut conflicts with Windows shortcut for switching desktops. When using (ctrl + win + left/right) to switch desktops, the shortcuts for switching tracks are also triggered.

**To Reproduce**
1) Open Musish. 
2) Have 2 or more virtual desktops in Windows 10.
3) Use the (ctrl + win + left/right) shortcut to switch between desktops. 
- Musish needs to be active.
4) Switching desktops while Musish is active will cause track changes. 

**Expected behavior**
Musish should reject the shortcuts if ctrl or win is held.

**Desktop:**

- OS: Windows 10
- Browser: Chrome
- Browser Version: 76.0.3809.100 (Official Build) (64-bit)

title: FEATURE: Lyrics auto scroll
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Lyrics auto scroll is added in iOS13. Hope to see this function in Musish as well! 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
When click lyrics button on the web interface, instead of showing static lyrics, show an auto scrolled lyrics.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
I haven't figured out what alternatives could be for lyrics auto scroll.

**Additional context**
Lyrics auto scroll is enabled on both iOS13 and iPadOS, but not macOS yet. It would be great if Musish add this feature before macOS!

title: BUG: Only playing low quality audio despite 256kbps option selected

labels.name: musickit limitation
labels.description: Requires updates to Apple Music API or MusicKit JS

body:
Firefox 68.0.1 / Windows 10 1903

Despite the "high quality 256kbps" radio button option being shown as selected when the settings icon is clicked, I am only getting lower quality audio. This is apparent both from listening and from using the browser's developer console to monitor network traffic - the amount of data being transferred after selecting a song matches up with 64kbps and is not nearly enough to be a 256kbps audio stream. For example, playing a nearly 4 minute long song transferred 2.89MB of data, with almost a MB of which is jpeg and script resources for the page, and a little under 2MB making up the actual mp4 chunks. 

The Widevine DRM module is set to always activated in Firefox. Session storage shows that the play.itunes.apple.com.WebObjects.MZPlay.woa.wa.widevineCert key is populated with an array length of 5, so it does appear to be loading in a certificate. I have attempted clearing the browser cache, disabling all extensions, toggling the quality option in Musish back and forth, etc. so far to no avail.

Steps to reproduce on my machine is to simply play any song, as this is affecting the entire client rather than any particular tracks or albums.

title: BUG: Can't login on some browsers, and can't play music on others (it only works on Opera)
body:
This project is really good, so much to learn from it, but there are some bugs in most of the browsers, I assume because of the MusicKitJS SDK being very new, but just in case, I'd love to know if these are known bugs and if they happen because of MusicKit or because of some bad code in the project :)


Firefox (68.0.1) & Edge (42.17134.1.0):
- Can't login and therefore can't play music
- To reproduce this bug just try to login and after you enter your Apple ID and password (and right before you can see the info of the app and approve/decline the auth) it will redirect you to an empty webpage, and in the console you'll see this error:
> ember-i18n has been deprecated in favor of ember-intl


Chrome (75.0.3770.142):
- Can login and see my private playlists
- Can't play music, and in the console there's this error:
> Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Failed to execute 'update' on 'MediaKeySession': Rejected with system code (36)


Opera (62.0.3331.72):
- Can login and see my private playlists
- Can play songs and playlists
- This is the only browser that everything works as it should (I havn't tested Safari though)

Thanks for sharing this amazing project!



### Updates:
Chrome:
The error I'm getting now is this one: (I can see that the song is buffering but the song can't be played)
> Cross-Origin Read Blocking (CORB) blocked cross-origin response https://aod-ssl.itunes.apple.com/itunes-assets/SOME-LONG-STRING-THAT-LOOKS-LIKE-IMPORTANT-PRIVATE-ID.mp4 with MIME type application/vnd.sun.wadl+xml. See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5629709824032768 for more details.

Firefox: (and probably any other browser that I checked and didn't work)
I found out that I only get the error in Firefox only when the language of my browser isn't English, and by changing the Firefox's language to English everything works as it should with Apple Music and you can login, view your library, play full length songs etc...

title: BUG: CONTENT_UNAVAILABLE and MEDIA_PLAYBACK: Not Playable
body:
**Describe the bug**
Hello, I currently have a Windows PC and I wanted to use Apple Music without having to use iTunes, as this Windows PC is actually my working machine.

I have a Japanese Apple Music account that successfully authenticates but it seems Musish isn't able to play songs, for whatever reason.

**To Reproduce**
1. Login to Musish (with Japanese Account?)
2. Try playing a song
3. Check Dev Tools (console)

**Expected behavior**
Should play the song.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22343587/60959206-180bc080-a308-11e9-9661-4c700c9337ee.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22343587/60959001-b4819300-a307-11e9-9548-d92199534319.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Windows 10
 - Chrome
 - v75.0.3770.100

**Additional context**
~~Also, it seems as my iCloud Music Library songs also aren't playable.~~

iCloud Stuff seems to be playable 99%. (Still some Japanese Songs seem to not work)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22343587/60959275-34a7f880-a308-11e9-97ae-4d9054d6b94f.png)

title: Remove from playlist

labels.name: musickit limitation
labels.description: Requires updates to Apple Music API or MusicKit JS

body: There appears to be no way to remove a track from a playlist. If there is, please let me know how. If there isn't, please add that feature.

title: BUG: Random play of tracks very limited
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I am in my 1000 music page (favorites) and I use the random play, music selected seems to be only from the first songs that are loaded by default (50?) not a random playlist of my 1000 favorites. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to My library , songs
2. Click on play and turn on random play icon
3. Click on the list icon (most right icon with small numbers) to see the random play list
and realize only a limited number of songs are possible. 
4. Click the Next song icon, several times till you notice, only a small set of songs are possible in the random play.

**Expected behavior**
The random list should get songs from all the 1000 favorites, not just the beginning of it.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS] ubuntu 18
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari] Chrome 
 - Version [e.g. 22]  75.0.3770.100

**workaround**
Scroll down list of all songs, till the end - very slow. Click random icon again.

title: Play recently added continuously/sort songs by date added
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Feature request regarding sorting of music in the **Songs** tab

**Describe the solution you'd like**
It would be great if we could sort the music in the **Songs** tab by ways other than song title, such as date added (essentially the **Recently Added** tab but have it display/act in individual song form.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
The only way to do this at the moment seems to be manually go through the **Recently Added** tab and click through each album automatically.

Another way to seemingly achieve this is to automatically iterate through the albums in the **Recently Added** tab when playing music from there.

**Additional context**
Just discovered this and you're saving me at work, so thank you!

title: FEATURE: Put "Love" icon next to songs
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
It is not related to a problem.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
When scrolling through a list of songs (whether in the main songs list, or on a playlist or album), There should be a heart icon on the right to indicate if you have Loved or disliked  a song. Pressing this icon will toggle the love/dislike state.


**Additional context**
Apple Music recently added the ability to get multiple personal song ratings in 1 request (previously it was 1 request for 1 song rating): https://developer.apple.com/documentation/applemusicapi/get_multiple_personal_song_ratings. So now, this functionality should be possible with only 1 additional request every time you load a list of songs.

title: FEATURE: remember volume between page reloads
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Everytime I reload the page, which happens semi-often, see #315, I have to adjust the volume again.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like the volume to be saved between page reloads.
